Class GameService

java.lang.Object
GameService
public class GameService extends Object
The class GameService holds all parameters and methods necessary to save the current game state. (The current and previous round) This is specifically important to compare the previous dice faceValues and toldValues for the MÃ¤xchen game functionality, as these are params important for the doubt, believe, truth and lie features of a normal game.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    GameService.DoubtResult
    This enum is an object that saves different cases.

    Description
    void
    endTurn()
    This method switches around the players and tells them through the console that they should change devices.
    Player
    getActivePlayer()
    This method checks which player (A or B) is currently playing and "active" In order to save the values to the correct player (and know who is the current(Active) player and who is the previous(Inactive) player) we implemented the getActivePlayer and getInactivePlayer methods.
    Player
    getInActivePlayer()
    This method checks which player (A or B) is currently not playing and "inactive" In order to save the values to the correct player (and know who is the current(Active) player and who is the previous(Inactive) player) we implemented the getActivePlayer and getInactivePlayer methods.

    An event method that is called when the beleive button is clicked Here we have a special case: If a MÃ¤xchen has been passed as a told Value by the previous player, the current player lose when they press the believe button

  • Method Details

    • registerUI

      public void registerUI(MyGUI ui)
      This method is used to connect the UI to the gameService
      Parameters:
      ui -

    • getInstance

      public static GameService getInstance()
      Creates an instance of the GamerService class in order to access the class from other class
      Returns:
      instance of the GameService class

    • isWon

      public boolean isWon()
      this method checks to see if either of the two players is drunk. A game is considered won if this is the case. See isDrunk() method
      Returns:
      boolean true or false

    • getActivePlayer

      public Player getActivePlayer()
      This method checks which player (A or B) is currently playing and "active" In order to save the values to the correct player (and know who is the current(Active) player and who is the previous(Inactive) player) we implemented the getActivePlayer and getInactivePlayer methods.
      Returns:
      playerA or playerB

    • getInActivePlayer

      public Player getInActivePlayer()
      This method checks which player (A or B) is currently not playing and "inactive" In order to save the values to the correct player (and know who is the current(Active) player and who is the previous(Inactive) player) we implemented the getActivePlayer and getInactivePlayer methods.
      Returns:
      playerA or playerB

    • getToldValueOfInActivePlayer

      public MaexchenDiceRoll getToldValueOfInActivePlayer()
      a gettermethod that gets the toldValue of the current player
      Returns:
      a toldValue of the currently playing player

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn()
      This method switches around the players and tells them through the console that they should change devices. The Console output was originally implemented for testing, but we choose to keep it, as it could be useful. See myTurn() method

    • nextPhase

      public void nextPhase()
      This method initiates the next phase of the game based on what the current phase is. Order of phases: ROLL_DICE_PHASE => END_PHASE => WAIT_FOR_END_ROUND => RECEIVE_PHASE => ROLL_DICE_PHASE etc.(Loop)

    • onPlayerShake

      public MaexchenDiceRoll onPlayerShake()
      An event method that is called when the skake button is clicked
      Returns:
      getActivePlayer().getFaceValue() = the value that has been actually rolled and was saved as a faceValue

    • onPlayerTruth

      public boolean onPlayerTruth()
      An event method that is called when the truth button is clicked
      Returns:
      boolean true or false See method tellTheTruth() = the value that has been actually rolled is both saved as the faceValue and the toldValue

    • onPlayerLie

      public boolean onPlayerLie(int value)
      An event method that is called when the lie button is clicked
      Returns:
      boolean true or false See method setToldValue() = the value that has been inputted as a lie by the player gets saved as a ToldValue

    • onEndTurnButton

      public boolean onEndTurnButton()
      An event method that is called when the end turn button is clicked
      Returns:
      boolean true or false

    • onBelieve

      public boolean onBelieve()
      An event method that is called when the beleive button is clicked Here we have a special case: If a MÃ¤xchen has been passed as a told Value by the previous player, the current player lose when they press the believe button
      Returns:
      boolean true or false

    • onPlayerDoubt

      public GameService.DoubtResult onPlayerDoubt()
      In this case this event method is used when the player shakes the Doubt button. As seen by the Enum used, the Doubt Event is special. The method also handles To which player the loss(and consequently the penalty shot) is assigned is based on whether the current player rightfully doubted or not.
      Returns:
      doubtResult = whether the doubtor WAS_RIGHT or WAS_WRONG

    • triggerUIUpdate

      public void triggerUIUpdate()
      this method triggers or forces the UI to update. This is necessary as there are different layouts for the UI, depening on the current game phase.
